arlut.csd.ganymede.server
Class JythonTask

java.lang.Object
  arlut.csd.ganymede.server.JythonTask
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class JythonTask
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

This class acts as a proxy for a separate Builder Task (a class that handles processing Ganymede's data for use in DNS/LDAP/Mail server/etc.) that's written in Jython. This task doesn't do much on its own; it simply bootstraps a Jython interpreter to a state where it can execute a "proper" builder task written in Jython and stored at an external location.

Every JythonTask needs to be registered in the Ganymede database via the task object type. They all require a single option string: the URI of the "real" builder task that is written in Jython. The URI can point to a resource using any protocol the Jython urllib module can handle (http://, file://, ftp://, etc).

The "real" task, written in Jython, is ideally a subclass of GanymedeBuilderTask (though it can simply be any class that implements the Runnable interface). This class will bootstrap a new Jython interpreter, load the class defined at the specified URI, and then execute that task's Runnable.run() method.

It's important to mention that no state is stored in-between runs of a Jython task. A new interpreter is initialized every time the task is run, and that interpreter is not shared by any other Jython task. So any variables that exist solely in the context of the Jython interpreter should be considered transient (not in the Java sense of the word, but in the English sense of the word).

Field Detail

taskDefObjInvid

private Invid taskDefObjInvid

The invid of this actual task definition. This is needed so we can snag this task's option strings from the database.

Constructor Detail

JythonTask

public JythonTask(Invid invid)
Method Detail

run

public final void run()

This method is the one invoked when the scheduler runs this task. It creates a new Jython interpreter, runs the bootstrapping code, and then executes the external Jython task.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

getURI

public java.lang.String getURI()

Parses this task's option string to grab the URI of the proxied Jython task. If there is more than one option string defined, the first one wins.

Returns:
The URI of the actual task (written in Jython) that does the work
